data.title: European Central Bank
data.meta_description: The European Central Bank (ECB) is the central bank of the European Union countries which have adopted the euro. Our main task is to maintain price stability in the euro area and so preserve the purchasing power of the single currency.
data.text:
SPEECH

Monetary policy in the euro area

In a panel session, Chief Economist Philip R. Lane discusses the effectiveness and transmission of euro area monetary policy at the Federal Reserve Bank of Kansas City’s Economic Symposium in Jackson Hole.

Read the speech

ACCOUNT

Account of July monetary policy meeting

Members of the Governing Council maintained that, as inflation was coming down only gradually, the policy response should be cautious. This supported a pause at the July monetary policy meeting. The Governing Council reiterated that there should be no pre-commitment to a particular rate path.

Read the account

PODCAST

The ECB Podcast Summer School #2

What does a day in the life of a banking supervisor look like? And why hardly anyone cares about their work – until things go wrong! Our host Stefania Secola discusses this and more with Ramón Quintana Aguirre, who is in charge of supervising the euro area’s largest banks.

Listen to The ECB Podcast
